activities: FLVS processes personal information for or on behalf of its individual and corporate clients and/or their legal counsel (“Client(s)”) in providing any of the following services: economic damage analysis, intellectual property damages, fraud and forensic accounting investigations, internal and regulatory investigations, restructuring and bankruptcy, business valuation, electronic discovery, digital forensics and/or related consulting services (“Services”).  In providing these Services, Personal Information may be collected by the Client directly or by FLVS personnel at the Client’s direction.  Also, in providing these Services, Personal Information may be sent to FLVS in the United States by the Client or by FLVS personnel at the Client’s direction.  During FLVS’s performance of Services, FLVS acts as an agent to perform tasks on behalf of and under the instructions of the Client.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
recoursemech:
Any interested persons with concerns regarding FLVS's Safe Harbor policy and its compliance with the Safe Harbor are encouraged to contact FLVS by using the information stated in its policy.  FLVS will investigate and attempt to resolve complaints and disputes regarding use and disclosure of personal information in accordance with the Safe Harbor Principles set forth in its policy.
For those European Union Clients for whom we are providing services in the United States who have questions or concerns about FLVS’s use of Personal Information, FLVS requests that such Clients first raise any inquiries or concerns regarding FLVS’s Safe Harbor policy with the FLVS representative with whom the Client is working.  
If there are any complaints relating to FLVS's policy that cannot be resolved through FLVS’s internal processes, FLVS has agreed to participate in the dispute resolution procedures of the panel established by the EU Data Protection Authorities to resolve disputes under the Safe Harbor Principles.  With regard to Switzerland, FLVS has agreed to cooperate with the Swiss Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner.
